channel.title: Camera zoomers
channel.description: Does anyone have any program that can make a the rs client camera zoom out so much that you can see several towns.....because with the other zoomers once you reach a certain height, everything starts dissapearing.... Iam looking for some program that can be implemented in the private server that can do this:[img]http://i26.photobucket.com/albums/c118/diablo1123/rs1.jpg[/img] thx.

item.description:
@frank wrote:

on that last note by pplsuqbawlz, an example:

the red square (which i stupidly edited in, rather than draw on the game screen), shows the apparent screen size, if any part of the tile/model is visible onscreen, the whole thing is included in the render

Read full topic

item.title: Camera zoomers
item.dc:creator: @pplsuqbawlz pplsuqbawlz
item.description:
@pplsuqbawlz wrote:

Doing the picture above isn’t really too complicated. It can be done with a few simple modifications: one of the camera, and changing the world manager to manage tiles far more than the current 104x104 :-p As far as loading is done, it should load off the cache fine, just dont let WorldManager call for the data across all of the larger tile grid as I’m fairly sure the server wont send it. You also need to turn off the FOW. (Fog of War)

Anyways: As far as practical applications? I see none, you can just make really cool pictures like that lol.
[hr]

Runescape isn’t a grid based game, it’s a tile based game. It’s easier to do clipping when there’s exact tiles than it is to do live clipping. Have any of you written your own engine like say the quake engine? Making live clips isnt exactly easy, holding all clips for every space and object’s physics should be left up to something like the Havok engine. (http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Havok_(software))

Read full topic

i managed to make a ‘zoomer’ that would view the entire current map section (had to expand an array from size 50 to ~200) but could be determined enough to bother to try to make it load several sections, the former wasnt that hard to do, but making it load several maps would be a downright bitch?
